intro: Calyptranthes websteri, commonly known as Webster's calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of western Mexico. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related species. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is often found in montane regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
